Solar Model¶

SolarModel Component¶

The solar model component is developed in OpenMDAO, but the calculation functions have been developed as stand-alone units. The primary OpenMDAO element that would be executed is the Solar Model Component, which is can be loaded by other OpenMDAO structures for automated execution.

SolarModel Class Input Attributes¶

    panelRating = Float(280.0, iotype='in', desc='panel rating')
    panelEff = Float(0.17, iotype='in', desc='panel efficiency')
    sunRadianceScalar = Float(1.0, iotype='in', desc='uncertainty around radiance')
    surfaceArea = Float(558.0, iotype='in', desc='number of panels')
    circuitLoss = Float(0.7, iotype='in', desc='circuit power loss')

SolarModel Class Output Attributes¶

    totalkWh = Float(110000.0, iotype='out', desc='yearly power output')
    solarCapitalCost = Float(150000.0, iotype='out', desc='investment cost')

SolarModel Class Definition¶

class Energy.Sources.Solar.Solar.SolarModel[source]¶

Bases: openmdao.main.component.Component

The SolarModel is an OpenMDAO component that wraps the actual calculations performed for the solar modeling, while defining the input and output attributes.

execute()[source]¶

The method that OpenMDAO requires that the behavior of the model be developed in. At each model execution, OpenMDAO will write new values into the model’s inputs, then will call this execute method. After the execution is complete, it will read total power and total initial capital cost information from it.

Returns:None
maxSurfaceArea = 1000.0¶

Maximum area in square meters available for installation

panelSize = 1.42¶

Fixed value for panel size in square meters

path = 'C:\\Users\\Nick\\.openmdao\\gui\\projects\\GeorgiaAquarium\\Energy\\Sources\\Solar'¶

SolarModel Calculations¶

Energy.Sources.Solar.calc_solar.calc_power(panelRating, panelEff, sunRadianceScalar, surfaceArea, circuitLoss, sunData)[source]¶

Calculates the total yearly power for the solar panel system. Utilizes a separate vectorized function for most of the computation. This function computes as much of the calculation as possible so that there is only a single value to be multiplied with each component of the array of daily solar data.

Parameters:
  • panelRating – Rated wattage of the solar panel. This can affect the price of the panels
  • panelEff – Rated efficiency of the panel in turning solar into stored energy
  • sunRadianceScalar – Uncertainty around how much the sun radiance would vary over many years
  • surfaceArea – The total desired area of solar panels to be implemented
  • circuitLoss – Reduces the power production by some uncertain amount based on inefficiencies in circuits
  • sunData – An array of a single year of solar radiance data
Returns:

Total power generated by solar over a year
Energy.Sources.Solar.calc_solar.calc_power_fast(sunData, multValue, theRange)[source]¶

Computes the total yearly power for the solar panel system. Uses numba just-in-time compilation to LLVM code to speed up the array operation 1000 times.

Multiplies value from calc_power by each element in array and aggregates into a sum The formatting of this function and loop are very specific to achieve large speed increase by numba, so make sure that any changes are compatible with numba by comparing run time using ipython %timeit magic from an ipython console.

Parameters:
  • sunData – The solar irradiance array for one year
  • multValue – The value to multiply each value in the array by
  • theRange – Length of the input array, input to avoid JIT compilation issues
Returns:

Sum off the power output from each day
Energy.Sources.Solar.calc_solar.calc_cost(panelEff, surfaceArea, panelRating, numPanels)[source]¶

Computes the cost of the solar design based on the solar cost per watt, panel rating in watts, and the number of panels that are chosen. Solar cost per watt is calculated based on a model that was developed from NREL System Adviser Model. The most important thing is that the cost increases as the panel efficiency and surface area increases.

Parameters:
  • panelEff – The efficiency of the panel as a decimal
  • surfaceArea – The area of the panel in square meters
  • panelRating – The rating in watts for the panel’s power generation
  • numPanels – The integer number for the quantity of solar panels
Returns:

Total initial capital cost in dollars for this single design configuration
Energy.Sources.Solar.calc_solar.calc_num_panels(surfaceArea, panelSize)[source]¶

Finds the number of panels that will fit in the desired area.

Parameters:
  • surfaceArea – The surface area where the solar panels are installed
  • panelSize – The size in square meters of each solar panel
Returns:

The number of solar panels for this solution

SolarModel Optimization¶

An OpenMDAO assembly, configured to use a pyOpt optimization driver, and configured with parameters corresponding to the SolarModel inputs. This can be used for testing the model before integration with other models.

class Energy.Sources.Solar.Solar.SolarOptimization[source]¶

Bases: openmdao.main.assembly.Assembly

Implements an assembly to contain the SolarModel component, and run optimizations on it stand-alone with the pyOpt plugin of optimization drivers. Implements a caserecorder so that you can investigate the results afterwards. This assembly will show up automatically when using openmdao gui, or can be used directly in another python script as you would use a regular python class.

configure()[source]¶

This method is used to implement the custom behavior of the SolarOptimization Assembly. OpenMDAO requires that you implement this method, and it is used to add the optimization component, the SolarModel, and to configure the parameters within the optimization component.

Returns:Outputs optimization results to the console and saves all data for inputs and outputs into a CSV file named ‘solar_optimization.csv’.
